info.title: Constituent
info.description: This API manages constituent information and related entities such as addresses, phones, emails, and notes.

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of actions.

The default sorting behavior is to list actions in ascending order based on when they were created.

However, the last_modified parameter overrides the default sorting behavior to list actions in ascending order based on when they were last modified. The last_modified parameter also adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that actions are stably sorted and that order persists when changes occur while working through a paginated list.

If the last_modified and date_added parameters are both specified, the sorting behavior is to list actions based on when they were last modified.

parameters.name: computed_status
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results based on the computed action status. Available values are 'Open', 'Completed', or 'PastDue'.  Currently, only a single value can be supplied in the filter.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results created on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that actions are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results modified on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that actions are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: sort_token
parameters.description: Represents a token filter to provide the next stable-sorted list of actions and to ensure that the order persists even if changes occur while working through a paginated list. The token is provided on the next_link collection response property when the request specifies the sort_token filter. The last_modified, date_added, and sort parameters also add the token to the next_link URL, although the sort parameter only adds the token when it sorts by just the date_added field or just the date_modified field.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results based on the action status. Returns actions if any of the specified status codes match any of their status codes. For example, "status_code=Closed&status_code=Pending" returns actions with a status of either "Closed" or "Pending".

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of actions to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.description: Defines a continuation token for the current result set that should be used when fetching the next page of results from list platform.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination. Deprecated for environments with access to new Action lists.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains a collection of action entities.

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of addresses.

The default sorting behavior is to list addresses in ascending order based on when they were created.

However, the last_modified parameter overrides the default sorting behavior to list addresses in ascending order based on when they were last modified. The last_modified and date_added parameters also add the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that addresses are stably sorted and that order persists when changes occur while working through a paginated list.

If the last_modified and date_added parameters are both specified, the sorting behavior is to list addresses based on when they were last modified.

Note: This endpoint returns data with an average latency of about 30 minutes.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Represents a filter for addresses created on or after the specified date. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Represents a filter for addresses modified on or after the specified date. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: sort_token
parameters.description: Represents a token filter to provide the next stable-sorted list of addresses. This will be provided on the next_link collection response property when last_modified or sort_token filters are specified on the request.

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Set this parameter to "true" to include inactive addresses in the response.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: Represents a list of constituent identifiers. Returns addresses if any of the specified constituent identifiers match any of the addresses' associated constituents. For example, "constituent_id=280&constituent_id=1232" returns addresses with either "280" or "1232" constituent identifiers.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of constituents.

The default sorting behavior is to list constituents in ascending alphabetical order based on the full name of organizations and the last name of individuals. However, some parameters override the default sorting behavior. The sort parameter sorts based on the fields that it specifies, and the sort_token parameter sorts based on the next stable-sorted list of results. (These parameters cannot be provided together.) If the sort and sort_token parameters are not provided, then the last_modified parameter sorts constituents in ascending order based on when they were last modified and the date_added parameter sorts constituents in ascending order based on when they were created. (If the last_modified and date_added parameters are both specified, sorting is based on the last-modified date.)

Some parameters also add the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that constituents are stably sorted and that the order persists even if changes occur while working through a paginated list. The last_modified, date_added, and sort parameters all add the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL, although the sort parameter only adds the sort_token parameter when it sorts by just the date_added field or just the date_modified field.

Note: This endpoint returns data with an average latency of about 30 minutes.

parameters.name: constituent_code
parameters.description: Represents a list of constituent codes. Returns constituents if any of the specified constituent codes match any of their assigned constituent codes, even if the current date is not within the date range for that constituent code. For example, "constituent_code=Board Member&constituent_code=Volunteer" returns constituents with either "Board Member" or "Volunteer" constituent codes.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: Represents a list of constituent identifiers. Returns constituents if any of the specified constituent identifiers match any of their constituents. For example, "constituent_id=280&constituent_id=1232" returns constituents with either "280" or "1232" constituent identifiers.

parameters.name: custom_field_category
parameters.description: Represents a list of custom field categories. Returns constituents if any of the specified custom field categories match any of their active custom fields. For example, "custom_field_category=Interests&custom_field_category=Anniversary" returns constituents with either "Interests" or "Anniversary" custom fields.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Represents the fields to include on the returned records. For example, "fields=id,first,last,deceased_date". The id field will always be returned.

parameters.name: fundraiser_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of fundraiser statuses. Returns constituents if any of the specified fundraiser statuses match the constituent's fundraiser status. For example, "fundraiser_status=Active,None" returns constituents whose fundraiser status that matches Active or None.  Valid values for this filter are Active, Inactive, and None.

parameters.name: include_deceased
parameters.description: Set this parameter to "true" to include deceased constituents in the response. Default value is "false".

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Set this parameter to "true" to include inactive constituents in the response. Default value is "false".

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of constituents to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of postal codes. Returns constituents if any of the specified postal codes match the postal code for their preferred address. For example, "postal_code=99577,14623" returns constituents whose preferred address has a postal code that matches or starts with 99577 or 14623, such as 99577, 14623, or 99577-0727.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results created on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that constituents are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results modified on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that constituents are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: sort_token
parameters.description: Represents a token filter to provide the next stable-sorted list of results and to ensure that the order persists even if changes occur while working through a paginated list. The token is provided on the next_link collection response property when the request specifies the sort_token filter. The last_modified, date_added, and sort parameters also add the token to the next_link URL, although the sort parameter only adds the token when it sorts by just the date_added field or just the date_modified field.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Represents a list of fields to sort the results by. Returns a list that sorts constituents based on the supplied fields. Results are in ascending order by default, and a '-' sign denotes descending order. For example, "sort=date_added,-last" sorts constituents by the "date_added" field in ascending order and then by the "last" field in descending order.
If only the date_modified field or only the date_added field is provided, then this adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that constituents are stably sorted.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

get.description:
Performs a constituent search based on the provided search text. Supports first name, last name, preferred name, former name, alias, email address, phone number, address, or lookup ID. Name combinations, such as first name and last name or preferred name and last name, are valid, but otherwise search only supports one parameter at a time.

By default, searches include results that sound similar to your criteria. For example, searches for "Smith" include matches for "Smyth" and other alternative spellings.

Searching by phone number requires a minimum of 7 digits with no spaces or special characters. This search does not support wildcard characters such as * or ? used to search in the database view.

If searching on a lookup id, the search_field property should be set to 'lookup_id'. This will allow the search results to be returned quicker.

If searching on an email address, the search_field property should be set to 'email_address'. This will allow the search results to be returned quicker. By default, the results include non-constituents.

Search results are limited to 500 records.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: The text to search for. If the search_text is a lookup_id, set the search_field to "lookup_id". If the search_text is an email address, set the search_field to "email_address".

parameters.name: fundraiser_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of fundraiser statuses. Returns constituents if any of the specified fundraiser statuses match the constituent's fundraiser status. For example, "fundraiser_status=Active,None" returns constituents whose fundraiser status that matches Active or None.  Valid values for this filter are Active, Inactive, and None.

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Set this parameter to "true" to include inactive constituents in the response.

parameters.name: search_field
parameters.description:
Represents a field to search on. Currently, it supports lookup_id and email_address. Set search_field to lookup_id or email_address and then set search_text to the lookup_id or email_address to find.
By default, setting the search_field to email_address will return both constituent and non-constituent records with email addresses that match the search_text. Set include_non_constituents to "false" to exclude non-constituent records from the results.

parameters.name: strict_search
parameters.description: Set this parameter to "true" to exclude constituents whose names sound like the search text but are spelled differently.

parameters.name: include_non_constituents

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of constituent custom fields.

The default sorting behavior is to list constituent custom fields in ascending order based on when they were created.

However, the last_modified parameter overrides the default sorting behavior to list constituent custom fields in ascending order based on when they were last modified. The last_modified parameter also adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that constituent custom fields are stably sorted and that order persists when changes occur while working through a paginated list.

If the last_modified and date_added parameters are both specified, the sorting behavior is to list constituent custom fields based on when they were last modified.

Note: This endpoint returns data with an average latency of about 30 minutes. In addition, historic records have a default date_added timestamp of 1600-01-01 00:00:00.000 +00:00. The timestamp for newer records reflects when the records were added.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Represents a filter for constituent custom fields created on or after the specified date. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Represents a filter for constituent custom fields modified on or after the specified date. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: sort_token
parameters.description: Represents a token filter to provide the next stable-sorted list of constituent custom fields. This will be provided on the next_link collection response property when last_modified or sort_token filters are specified on the request.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Represents a filter for a custom field category. Although the field is an array, the endpoint only returns custom fields that match a single specified category. For example, category=Interests returns custom fields with the Interests category.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Represents a filter for custom field values. Must be used in conjunction with the category filter. Returns any custom fields in the specified category that match any of the specified values. For example, category=Interests&value=Baseball&value=Tennis returns Interests custom fields with the Baseball or Tennis values. Filtering by fuzzy date values must be in one of the following formats: YYYYMMDD, YYYY, YYYYMM, or MMDD. Any four digit value that starts with 13 or higher will be considered a year. Any four digit value that starts with 01-12 will be considered to be in MMDD format.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Represents an option to include the count of all records. Default is true.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains a collection of custom field entities.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the custom fields.

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of relationships.

The default sorting behavior is to list relationships in ascending order based on when they were created.

However, the last_modified parameter overrides the default sorting behavior to list relationships in ascending order based on when they were last modified. The last_modified parameter also adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that relationships are stably sorted and that order persists when changes occur while working through a paginated list.

If the last_modified and date_added parameters are both specified, the sorting behavior is to list relationships based on when they were last modified.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results created on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that relationships are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results modified on or after the specified date. Adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that relationships are stably sorted. The filter respects time offsets from UTC per the ISO-8601 format: 2016-05-05T17:59:31.1600745-04:00.

parameters.name: sort_token
parameters.description: Represents a token filter to provide the next stable-sorted list of relationships and to ensure that the order persists even if changes occur while working through a paginated list. The token is provided on the next_link collection response property when the request specifies the sort_token filter. The last_modified, date_added, and sort parameters also add the token to the next_link URL, although the sort parameter only adds the token when it sorts by just the date_added field or just the date_modified field.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

get.description: Returns possible duplicate records. Searches individual, organization, and related contact records and ranks results based on search filters. Records that match multiple filters rank higher as potential duplicates.

parameters.name: last_org_name
parameters.description: A required filter for records that match the specified last name or organization name.

parameters.name: search_individuals
parameters.description: A filter indicating whether to search for duplicate individual or organization records. This property defaults to true if no value is provided.

parameters.name: search_aliases
parameters.description: A filter indicating whether to search by the alias specified in the last_org_name parameter. This property defaults to false if no value is provided.

parameters.name: search_contacts
parameters.description: A filter indicating whether to search relationship contact records. This property defaults to false if no value is provided.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: A filter for individual records that match the specified first name.

parameters.name: middle_name
parameters.description: A filter for individual records that match the specified middle name.

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.description: A filter for individual records that match the specified suffix.

parameters.name: address_block
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified address block.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified city.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified state.

parameters.name: post_code
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified postcode.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified email addresses.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A filter for records that match the specified phone numbers.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return when paging results (Default = 3).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip when paging results.

200.description: The response body contains a collection of duplicate search result entities.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the constituent.

id.description: The immutable system record ID of the action.

category.description: The channel or intent of the constituent interaction. Available values are Phone Call, Meeting, Mailing, Email, and Task/Other.

completed.description: Indicates whether the action is complete. If the system is configured to use custom action statuses, this value is based on the action status value. This property defaults to false if no value is provided.

completed_date.description: The date when the action was completed. Uses ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43.

computed_status.description: The computed action status. If the system is not configured to use custom action statuses, this field computes the status based on the completed and date properties. If not, the field calculates the status based on the action's date property and whether action's Action Status property is configured as completed.

constituent_id.description: The immutable system record ID of the constituent associated with the action.

date_added.description: The date when the action was created. Includes an offset from UTC in ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43-04:00.

date_modified.description: The date when the action was last modified. Includes an offset from UTC in ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43-04:00.

description.description: The detailed explanation that elaborates on the action summary.

direction.description: The direction of the action. Available values are Inbound and Outbound.

end_time.description: The end time of the action. Uses 24-hour time in the HH:mm format. For example, 17:30 represents 5:30 p.m.

fundraisers.description: The set of immutable constituent system record IDs for the fundraisers associated with the action.

location.description: The location of the action. Available values are the entries in the Action Locations table.

opportunity_id.description: The immutable system record ID of the opportunity associated with the action.

outcome.description: The outcome of the action. Available values are Successful and Unsuccessful.

priority.description: The priority of the action. Available values are Normal, High, and Low. The default is Normal.

start_time.description: The start time of the action. Uses 24-hour time in the HH:mm format. For example, 17:30 represents 5:30 p.m.

status.description: The action status. If the system is configured to use custom action statuses, available values are the entries in the Action Status table. If not, this field computes the status based on the completed and date properties: If an action is not completed and has a current or future date, the status is Open; if an action is not completed and has a past date, the status is Past due; and if an action is completed, the status is Completed.

status_code.description: The action status code. Available values are in the Action Status table. This property is only returned when the system is configured to use custom action statuses.

summary.description: The short description of the action that appears at the top of the record.

type.description: Additional description of the action to complement the category. Available values are the entries in the Actions table.

id.description: The immutable system record ID of the attachment.

content_type.description: The content type. For physical attachments only.

date.description: The date of the attachment. Uses ISO-8601 format:1969-11-21T10:29:43-04:00.

file_name.description: The file name. For physical attachments only.

file_size.description: The file size in bytes. For physical attachments only.

name.description: The name of the attachment.

parent_id.description: The parent object's immutable system record ID.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment. Tags supplement the attachments name and description and identify it based on how an organization categorizes attachments. Available values are the entries in the Document Tags table.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL for a thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only. Contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 30 minutes.

type.description: The attachment type. Available values are Link and Physical. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. The URL for a physical attachment contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 30 minutes.

AttachmentRead.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

type.description: The attachment type. Available values are Link and Physical. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments but does not apply to physical attachments.

ApiCollectionOfAddressRead.description: Fetching data all at once quickly becomes unmanageable. The collection entity helps by returning paginated chunks of large data sets. This entity includes helpful metadata and properties to paginate and iterate through the data.

id.description: The immutable system record ID of the address.

constituent_id.description: The immutable system record ID of the constituent associated with the address.

date_added.description: The date when the address was created. Includes an offset from UTC in ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43-04:00.

date_modified.description: The date when the address was last modified. Includes an offset from UTC in ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43-04:00.

do_not_mail.description: Indicates whether the constituent requests not to be contacted at this address.

end.description: The date when the constituent ceased to reside at this address. Uses ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43.

formatted_address.description: This computed field retrieves the formatted address in the configured format of the country.

inactive.description: This computed field indicates that the address is active if the current date is before any end date.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the address.

preferred.description: Indicates whether this is the constituent's preferred address.

start.description: The date when the constituent began residing at this address. Uses ISO-8601 format: 1969-11-21T10:29:43.

type.description: The address type. Available values are the entries in the Address Types table.

AddressRead.description: Addresses store information about constituent residences and other addresses along with information about where or whether to send mail.
AddressRead.x-additional-info:
Some Address entity properties include international address support.

Property United States Canada United Kingdom Australia New Zealand
address_lines
city *
suburb
state !
postal_code
county
country

* Australia — For GET operations, the city property returns city or suburb data. For POST and PATCH operations, you can use either the suburb or city properties, but not both. An error occurs if you provide values for both properties.

! Canada — Use the state property to track provinces.

is_organization_contact.description: Indicates whether the related individual represents the organization as a contact. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

is_primary_business.description: Indicates whether the related organization is the individual's primary business. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

is_spouse.description: Indicates whether the related constituent is the constituent's spouse. Only applies to relationships between individuals.

is_spouse_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the spouse constituent is the head household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

is_constituent_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the constituent is the head of household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

name.description: The name of the related constituent. If the constituent's type is Individual, this computed field indicates the full name of the constituent based on the target organizations display name settings.

organization_contact_type.description: Provides context for interactions with the related individual who represents the organization as a contact. Available values are the entries in the Contact Types table. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

position.description: The individual's position in the organization. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

reciprocal_relationship_id.description: The identifier for the reciprocal relationship record. This value is read-only and is automatically generated when the relationship is created. Changes made to this record will also be reflected on the reciprocal, with the exception of the comments property.

reciprocal_type.description: Describes the constituent's relationship to the related constituent. For example, in a relationship between a male constituent and a female sibling, the reciprocal relationship type would be brother. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

relation_id.description: The immutable system record ID of the related individual or organization.

type.description: The type of relation that the relationship represents. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

first_name.description: The first name of the constituent. For individuals only.

last_name.description: The last name of the constituent. For individuals only.

RelationshipRead.description: Relationships describe connections between constituents and other individuals and organizations such as family, friends, and employers. Tracking constituent relationships can enhance fundraising efforts and interactions.

is_primary_business.description: Indicates whether the related organization is the individual's primary business. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

is_spouse.description: Indicates whether the related constituent is the constituent's spouse. Only applies to relationships between individuals.

is_spouse_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the spouse constituent is the head household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

is_constituent_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the constituent is the head of household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

organization_contact_type.description: Provides context for interactions with the related individual who represents the organization as a contact. Available values are the entries in the Contact Types table. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

position.description: The individual's position in the organization. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals. Character limit: 50.

reciprocal_type.description: Describes the constituent's relationship to the related constituent. For example, in a relationship between a male constituent and a female sibling, the reciprocal relationship type would be brother. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

relation_id.description: The immutable system record ID of the related individual or organization.

type.description: The type of relation that the relationship represents. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

do_not_reciprocate.description: When set to true, indicates that a reciprocal relationship should not be created.

RelationshipAdd.description: Relationships describe connections between constituents and other individuals and organizations such as family, friends, and employers. Tracking constituent relationships can enhance fundraising efforts and interactions.

deceased.description: Indicates whether the constituent is deceased. For individuals only.

first.description: The constituent's first name. For individuals only. Character limit: 50.

former_name.description: The constituent's former name. For individuals only. Character limit: 100.

gender.description: The constituent's gender. Available values are the entries in the Gender table. This property defaults to Unknown if no value is provided. For individuals only.

last.description: The constituent's last name. For individuals only (required). Character limit: 100.

middle.description: The constituent's middle name. For individuals only. Character limit: 50.

name.description: If the constituent's type is Individual, this is a computed field that does not apply to add operations. If the type is Organization, this field is required and represents the organization's name. Character limit: 60.

preferred_name.description: The constituent's preferred name. For individuals only. Character limit: 50.

suffix.description: The constituent's primary suffix. Available values are the entries in the Suffixes table. For individuals only.

suffix_2.description: The constituent's secondary suffix. Available values are the entries in the Suffixes table. For individuals only.

title.description: The constituent's primary title. Available values are the entries in the Titles table. For individuals only.

title_2.description: The constituent's secondary title. Available values are the entries in the Titles table. For individuals only.

type.description: The type of constituent. Available values are Individual and Organization.

NonConstituentAdd.description: Non-constituents are the individuals and organizations related to constituents.

is_organization_contact.description: Indicates whether the related individual represents the organization as a contact. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

is_primary_business.description: Indicates whether the related organization is the individual's primary business. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

is_spouse.description: Indicates whether the related constituent is the constituent's spouse. Only applies to relationships between individuals.

is_spouse_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the spouse constituent is the head household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

is_constituent_head_of_household.description: Indicates whether the constituent is the head of household. Only applies to spousal relationships between individuals.

organization_contact_type.description: Provides context for interactions with the related individual who represents the organization as a contact. Available values are the entries in the Contact Types table. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals.

position.description: The individual's position in the organization. Only applies to relationships between organizations and individuals. Character limit: 50.

reciprocal_type.description: Describes the constituent's relationship to the related constituent. For example, in a relationship between a male constituent and a female sibling, the reciprocal relationship type would be brother. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

type.description: The type of relation that the relationship represents. Available values are the entries in the Relationships table.

RelationshipEdit.description: Relationships describe connections between constituents and other individuals and organizations such as family, friends, and employers. Tracking constituent relationships can enhance fundraising efforts and interactions.
